intro: Psoralea tomentosa, commonly known as the silky psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features hairy, glandular leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters and bloom during the warm season. Psoralea tomentosa is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
